title: Danger # 1-14 (Comic Media / Charlton)
description:
11 issues published Comic Media 1953-1954
3 issues published by Charlton 1955

With sweet artwork by Don Heck and Pete Morisi

Originally bearing the tagline "Men Without Fear" for the first five issues, the stories were generally of the adventure genre but with the sixth issue the tagline changed to "Secret Agents...Spies/Espionage...Intrigue" and the book took on a spy theme, now featuring a recurring character, Duke Douglas. However, after the eleventh issue the series ended with a short resurrection at Charlton a year later for three issues that kept the spy tagline but dropped featuring Duke Douglas on the cover. By the final issue, it was mainly just reprinting earlier stories featured in the comic
